turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Colombo.
turn.1: What are the most famous landmarks in Colombo?
turn.2: Famous landmarks in Colombo include Galle Face Green, Viharamahadevi Park, Beira Lake, Colombo Racecourse, Planetarium, University of Colombo, Mount Lavinia beach, Dehiwala Zoological Garden, Nelum Pokuna Theatre, Colombo Lotus Tower as well as the National Museum.
turn.3: Where does the name Colombo come from?
turn.4: The name ‘Colombo’, first introduced by the Portuguese in 1505, is believed to be derived from the classical Sinhala name "Kolon thota", meaning "port on the river Kelani".
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: Another belief is that the name is derived from the Sinhala name "Kola-amba-thota" which means ’Harbour with leafy/green mango trees’.
turn.8: This coincides with Robert Knox's history of the island while he was a prisoner in Kandy.
turn.10: He writes that, "On the West the City of Columbo, so called from a Tree the Natives call Ambo, (which bears the Mango-fruit) growing in that place; but this never bare fruit, but onely leaves, which in their Language is Cola and thence they called the Tree Colambo: which the Christians in honour of Columbus turned to Columbo." The author of the oldest Sinhala grammar, "Sidatsangarava," written in the 13th century wrote about a category of words that exclusively belonged to early Sinhala.
turn.12: It lists "naramba" (to see) and "kolamba" (ford or harbour) as deriving from the indigenous Vedda language.
